eshmun.gui.synchronizationskeletons

Class SynchronizationSkeletonPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • eshmun.gui.synchronizationskeletons.SynchronizationSkeletonPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SynchronizationSkeletonPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The drawing panel in which a Synchronization Skeleton is displayed.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The scroll pane in which this Panel reside.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(SkeletonState s)
      Adds s to the skeleton, if s's label is already existing returns false without adding it.
      void add(SkeletonTransition t)
      Adds a transition.
      void addStartState(SkeletonState s)
      Adds s to the start states, Note that s should exist inside the states prior to calling this method to guarantee success.
      void applyScale(double scale)
      zoom in according to the given scale.
      void autoFormat()
      Auto formats the skeleton.
      private void autoFormat(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Auto formats the synchronization Skeleton.
      boolean checkLegalLabel(SkeletonState l)
      Checks if the state l has a unique label.
      void clear()
      Clears the content of this GraphPanel.
      java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonState> copyStates()
      returns a copy of the states (deep copy), saves the new copied stated in this.map .
      java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonTransition> copyTransitions()
      returns a copy of the transitions (deep copy).
      void delete(SkeletonState s)
      Deletes a state with its transitions.
      void delete(SkeletonTransition t)
      Deletes a transition.
      DragAndDropHandler getDragAndDropHandler() 
      int getDrawableHeight()
      Gets the maximum height so far reached.
      int getDrawableWidth()
      Gets the maximum width so far reached.
      SynchronizationSkeletonFrame getFrame()
      Gets the frame this panel belongs to.

      java.awt.Point getMousePopupPoint()

      Gets the saveable structure.
      double getScale()
      Returns the scaling factor for zoom.
      double[] getScales()
      Get the zoom scales.
      javax.swing.JScrollPane getScrollPane()
      gets the JScrollPane this GraphPanel reside in.
      SkeletonState getSelectedState()
      Gets the selected state (null if no selection).
      SkeletonTransition getSelectedTransition()
      Gets the selected transition (null if no selection).
      SkeletonState getStateByLocation(java.awt.Point p)
      Gets the state that occupies the given location, if more than one state occupy this point, returns the most recent.
      StatePopupMenu getStatePopupMenu() 
      SkeletonTransition getTransitionByLocation(java.awt.Point p)
      Gets the transition that occupies the given location, if more than one transition occupy this point, returns the oldest.
      TransitionPopupMenu getTransitionPopupMenu() 
      UndoManager getUndoManager() 
      void load(SkeletonSaveObject obj)
      Loads Synchronization Skeletons from inside the given save object.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
      protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paints the components, i,e paints the states, transitions, movements and other graphics.
      void paintComponents(java.awt.Graphics g, boolean exportToImage)
      Paints the components, however this to an image if exportToImage is set to true.
      void paintContours(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paints the contours (dashed rectangular shapes surrounding the skeletons).
      void propagateProcess(SkeletonState s)
      Propagates the given states process to all states connected to it.
      void resetUndoManager()
      Resets the undo manager.
      void resetZoom()
      Reset zoom to no zoom (scales of 1).
      void save(java.lang.String path)
      Constructs a save object containing this skeletons and save it to the path.
      void setSelectedState(SkeletonState selectedState)
      Sets the selected state (set to null to deselect).
      void setSelectedTransition(SkeletonTransition selectedTransition)
      Sets the selected transition (set to null to deselect).
      void setStates(java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonState> states)
      set the states inside the GraphPanel.
      void setTransitions(java.util.ArrayList<SkeletonTransition> transitions)
      set the transitions inside the GraphPanel.
      void setZoomToolbar(SynchronizationZoomToolBar zoomToolbar)
      Sets the zoom toolbar to call back when zooming.
      java.awt.Point translatePoint(java.awt.Point p)
      Translate point from a coordinate system with the current zoom, to a point in the original system.
      java.awt.Point translatePointReverse(java.awt.Point p)
      Translate point from a coordinate system with no zoom.
      void zoomIn()
      Zoom in, no specific focus point.
      void zoomIn(java.awt.Point newLocation)
      Zoom in, with the focus point being newLocation (the container would be moved to have this point almost centered), if null no focus point is considered.
      void zoomOut()
      Zoom out, no specific focus point.
      void zoomOut(java.awt.Point newLocation)
      Zoom out, with the focus point being newLocation (the container would be moved to have this point almost centered), if null no focus point is considered.

      • getStateByLocation

        public SkeletonState getStateByLocation(java.awt.Point p)
        Gets the state that occupies the given location, if more than one state occupy this point, returns the most recent.
        Parameters:
        p - the location.
        Returns:
        the state that occupies p.

      • getTransitionByLocation

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the transition that occupies p.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the content of this GraphPanel.

        Undo manger can undo this action.

      • translatePoint

        public java.awt.Point translatePoint(java.awt.Point p)
        Translate point from a coordinate system with the current zoom, to a point in the original system.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the translated point.

      • translatePointReverse

        public java.awt.Point translatePointReverse(java.awt.Point p)
        Translate point from a coordinate system with no zoom. to a point in the system with the current zoom.
        Parameters:
        p - point to translate.
        Returns:
        the translated point.

      • getScales

        public double[] getScales()
        Get the zoom scales.
        Returns:
        an array with the zoom scales : [Xscale, Yscale].

      • zoomIn

        public void zoomIn()
        Zoom in, no specific focus point.

      • zoomIn

        public void zoomIn(java.awt.Point newLocation)
        Zoom in, with the focus point being newLocation (the container would be moved to have this point almost centered), if null no focus point is considered.
        Parameters:
        newLocation - the point of focus.

      • zoomOut

        public void zoomOut()
        Zoom out, no specific focus point.

      • zoomOut

        public void zoomOut(java.awt.Point newLocation)
        Zoom out, with the focus point being newLocation (the container would be moved to have this point almost centered), if null no focus point is considered.
        Parameters:
        newLocation - the point of focus.

      • resetZoom

        public void resetZoom()
        Reset zoom to no zoom (scales of 1).

      • getScale

        public double getScale()
        Returns the scaling factor for zoom.
        Returns:
        the scale

      • applyScale

        public void applyScale(double scale)
        zoom in according to the given scale.
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale to zoom by. the same scale is applied for X, Y axis.
